Tourney from a dane's pov

POV: Uthgar

Log Rating: 3.0000

1st round was cool, 2nd suck, 3rd ok, finals soso ..also american links suck!!!

ROUND 1

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2>
The Tournament Has Begun!
You have fifteen (15) seconds to leave the room, or your team will be
transferred out automatically.

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D> l
Starting Arena For Team 1
You are in a large peaceful hall, the starting arena for your team. A
sense of calm foreboding invades your soul as you prepare yourself for what
lies ahead.
if you see this, please contact an immortal
A man stands here, ready to prepare you for the tournament.
Tariel the Male Hill Dwarf is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Woa Nitro, Honorary Blood Sea Dane is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D>
Woa tells your group 'can I be honorary dane'

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D>
Woa tells your group 'if we win?'

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D>
Kooz tells your group 'tariel remember to flee alot'

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D> peer

From a small monitor: Palerin stops following someone.

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D> You peer around you.

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D> ex
Obvious exits:
Down - Starting Arena For Team 1

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D>
From a small monitor: someone says 'sec'

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D>
From a small monitor: someone says 'brb'

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:D> d
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Woa Nitro, Honorary Blood Sea Dane is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Tariel the Male Hill Dwarf is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NSD> ex
Obvious exits:
North - A Path In The Mountains
South - A Path In The Mountains
Down - A Path Around A Mountain

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NSD> sca
Looking north:
You see nothing special.
Looking east:
You see nothing special.
Looking south:
You see nothing special.
Passu Engelbrekt is standing here.
. . . has a tough exterior.
Enri the Male Hylar Dwarf is standing here.
. . . has a tough exterior.
Yuhee, Six Wrecks and Forty Disasters is standing here. (flying)
. . . is surrounded by a white mist.
Ronk, Gnomish Legion of Doom is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Looking west:
You see nothing special.
Looking up:
You see nothing special.
Looking down:
You see nothing special.
Bonham, Led Canuck is standing here. (flying)
Sann I Tation, Honorary Canuck is standing here. (flying)
Mytto, Canuck Instincts Defined is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Skorpio, Slave and Wife to Suf is standing here. (flying)

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NSD>
There is lightning in the sky.

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NSD>
Kooz flies south.

423H 150V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NSD> TICK IN 16 SECONDS.
s
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here, fighting Yuhee. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Yuhee, Six Wrecks and Forty Disasters is standing here, fighting Kooz. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

423H 148V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW>
Ronk flies in from the west.
Enri arrives from the west.
Passu arrives from the west.

423H 148V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW>
Passu CRASHES into Tariel in a thundering collision, knocking him to the ground!

423H 148V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW>
Enri appears to be dancing around the room.

423H 148V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW>
Enri pierces Tariel extremely hard.

423H 148V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW> s
Alas, you cannot go that way...

423H 148V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW> w

Enri misses Tariel with his pierce.
Passu massacres Tariel with his cleave.
Tariel bludgeons Passu extremely hard.
Yuhee misses Kooz with his slash.
Kooz stabs Yuhee very hard.
Kooz is chilled, as he swings at Yuhee.

423H 148V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW> A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

423H 146V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:EWD> e

location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

. . . has a tough exterior.

. . . has a tough exterior.
Tariel the Male Hill Dwarf is SITTING here, fighting Passu. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here, fighting Yuhee. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Yuhee, Six Wrecks and Forty Disasters is standing here, fighting Kooz. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

423H 144V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW>
Yuhee steps aside as Kooz attempts a bash, stumbles, and falls flat on his face.

423H 144V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NW> c 'sunray'
You utter the words, 'sunray'
Your hands send forth blinding rays of sunlight!
Passu withers as a ray of sunlight engulfs him!
Enri withers as a ray of sunlight engulfs him!
Ronk withers as a ray of sunlight engulfs him!
Ronk seems to be BLINDED!
Yuhee withers as a ray of sunlight engulfs him!

423H 144V 1X 1C [Me:Perfect] [Tariel:Fair] [Passu:V.Good] Mem:5 Exits:NW>
Woa CRASHES into Yuhee in a thundering collision, knocking him to the ground!

423H 144V 1X 1C [Me:Perfect] [Tariel:Fair] [Passu:V.Good] Mem:5 Exits:NW>
Woa massacres Yuhee with his stab.
Woa is chilled, as he swings at Yuhee.
Ronk stabs YOU hard.
You smite Passu extremely hard.
Enri pierces Tariel extremely hard.
Passu misses Tariel with his cleave.
Tariel bludgeons Passu very hard.
Kooz massacres Yuhee with his stab.
Kooz is chilled, as he swings at Yuhee.

414H 144V 1X 1C [Me:V.Good] [Tariel:Fair] [Passu:Good] Mem:5 Exits:NW> fle
fle
fle

Tariel <========== STANDS UP!!!!!!

414H 144V 1X 1C [Me:V.Good] [Tariel:Fair] [Passu:Good] Mem:5 Exits:NW> You flee head over heels.
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

414H 142V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:NSD> You're not fighting, why bother fleeing?

The cloud-veiled sky becomes even darker as the sun sets.
Timer now at 62 secs.
Enri panics, and attempts to flee.
Enri leaves north.

The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be

303H 146V 1X 1C [Me:Fair] [Traja:Fair] Mem:14 Exits:NW> l
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Tariel the Male Hill Dwarf is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Woa Nitro, Honorary Blood Sea Dane is standing here, fighting Qureyos. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Qureyos "Not On My Shift!" Wild is SITTING here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

Poi <========== STANDS UP!!!!!!
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Lord Krite D'Nye, Darkest Knight of Takhisis is standing here, fighting Kooz. (flying)
Poi, Defender of Goka is standing here, fighting Traja.
Tariel the Male Hill Dwarf is standing here, fighting Zanin. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Woa Nitro, Honorary Blood Sea Dane is standing here, fighting Traja. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

311H 150V 1X 1C [Me:Good] [Kooz:Fair] [Traja:Bad] Mem:29 Exits:NW> A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Woa Nitro, Honorary Blood Sea Dane is RESTING here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Tariel the Male Hill Dwarf is RESTING here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

320H 142V 1X 1C [Me:Good] [Tariel:Awful] [Ocho:Fair] Mem:6 Exits:EWD> tar

Rachel focuses harshly on Tariel and utters some strange words.
Tariel receives the full blast of a lightning bolt from Rachel ... and is no more.
Twinkling lights surround Tariel and he disappears.
A leather bag disintegrates.
A leather shirt disintegrates.
A leather helmet disintegrates.
A pair of leather pants disintegrates.
A pair of leather boots disintegrates.
A pair of leather gloves disintegrates.
A pair of leather sleeves disintegrates.
A gnarled, mossy staff of wood and stone crumbles and returns to the elements from which it was crafted.

320H 142V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:EWD> l
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

320H 142V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:EWD> e
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

336H 148V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:EWD> d
A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.

336H 146V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:EWU> e
A Path Around A Mountain
The path continues around the backside of the mountain but the east
side of the mountain is not distinguishable from the west side of the
mountain. The upper regions of the mountain are blocked by a thick fog
which seems to hang over the peak. Fierce winds howl throughout the
mountain giving it a greater sense of foreboding. There is no life anywhere
on the mountain just a few beaten paths that do not appear to have seen the
lines of the living for quite some time.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Sir Woobis of Anfield, Lord Clerist of the Knights of Solamnia is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

Some spiritual gauntlets disintegrates.
Some spiritual vambraces disintegrates.

336H 132V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:NWU> u
Nearing The Top of the Mountain
The summit of the mountain can barely be made out even at this
distance. The wind blows much harder near the top of the mountain and the
biting cold makes it a very unpleasant place to be. There is no life
anywhere on the mountain and the only sound that can be heard is that of
the wind smashing against the peaks of the mountain. The path seems to lead
around the peak of the mountain but it's difficult to ascertain where
exactly one is in relation to the lower regions of the mountain.

336H 114V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:NSUD> n
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here, fighting Qureyos. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Sir Traja Flourjd, Throws Down Renshai Style is standing here. (flying)
Zanin the Butcher is RESTING here. (flying)
The omniscient celestial, Antioch, gazes at you with eyes of gold.
You see the outline of a life form here, carrying: a spiritual hammer.
Lord Krite D'Nye, Darkest Knight of Takhisis is RESTING here. (flying)

A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.

A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.

Nearing The Top of the Mountain
The summit of the mountain can barely be made out even at this
distance. The wind blows much harder near the top of the mountain and the
biting cold makes it a very unpleasant place to be. There is no life
anywhere on the mountain and the only sound that can be heard is that of
the wind smashing against the peaks of the mountain. The path seems to lead
around the peak of the mountain but it's difficult to ascertain where
exactly one is in relation to the lower regions of the mountain.
Zanin the Butcher is standing here. (flying)

143H 129V 1X 1C Mem:7 Exits:EWUD> d
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

143H 123V 1X 1C Mem:7 Exits:ESD> d
A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.

162H 142V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NWD> d
A Path Around A Mountain
The path continues around the backside of the mountain but the east
side of the mountain is not distinguishable from the west side of the
mountain. The upper regions of the mountain are blocked by a thick fog
which seems to hang over the peak. Fierce winds howl throughout the
mountain giving it a greater sense of foreboding. There is no life anywhere
on the mountain just a few beaten paths that do not appear to have seen the
lines of the living for quite some time.
The omniscient celestial, Antioch, gazes at you with eyes of gold.
You see the outline of a life form here, carrying: a spiritual hammer.
Zanin the Butcher is standing here. (flying)
Lord Krite D'Nye, Darkest Knight of Takhisis is standing here. (flying)

372H 138V 1X 1C [Me:V.Good] [Woa:V.Good] [Krite:Good] Mem:9 Exits:NWU> flee
You flee head over heels.
A Path Around A Mountain
The bleak looking mountain shoots up into the air, seeming to pierce
the sky. It is difficult to see the top of the mountain due to the haze
that seems to be hanging around the mountain. Fierce winds blow causing
strange noises to be heard everywhere. No life can be seen anywhere, this
place is dead to the world and seems to not to have seen the living in
eons. There is a feeling of danger that hangs over the mountain, obviously
one should tread lightly.

A Path Around A Mountain
The path continues around the backside of the mountain but the east
side of the mountain is not distinguishable from the west side of the
mountain. The upper regions of the mountain are blocked by a thick fog
which seems to hang over the peak. Fierce winds howl throughout the
mountain giving it a greater sense of foreboding. There is no life anywhere
on the mountain just a few beaten paths that do not appear to have seen the
lines of the living for quite some time.

A Path Around A Mountain
The bleak looking mountain shoots up into the air, seeming to pierce
the sky. It is difficult to see the top of the mountain due to the haze
that seems to be hanging around the mountain. Fierce winds blow causing
strange noises to be heard everywhere. No life can be seen anywhere, this
place is dead to the world and seems to not to have seen the living in
eons. There is a feeling of danger that hangs over the mountain, obviously
one should tread lightly.

Nearing The Top of the Mountain
The summit of the mountain can barely be made out even at this
distance. The wind blows much harder near the top of the mountain and the
biting cold makes it a very unpleasant place to be. There is no life
anywhere on the mountain and the only sound that can be heard is that of
the wind smashing against the peaks of the mountain. The path seems to lead
around the peak of the mountain but it's difficult to ascertain where
exactly one is in relation to the lower regions of the mountain.

211H 132V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NWU> w
A Path Around A Mountain
The bleak looking mountain shoots up into the air, seeming to pierce
the sky. It is difficult to see the top of the mountain due to the haze
that seems to be hanging around the mountain. Fierce winds blow causing
strange noises to be heard everywhere. No life can be seen anywhere, this
place is dead to the world and seems to not to have seen the living in
eons. There is a feeling of danger that hangs over the mountain, obviously
one should tread lightly.

A Path Around A Mountain
The path continues around the backside of the mountain but the east
side of the mountain is not distinguishable from the west side of the
mountain. The upper regions of the mountain are blocked by a thick fog
which seems to hang over the peak. Fierce winds howl throughout the
mountain giving it a greater sense of foreboding. There is no life anywhere
on the mountain just a few beaten paths that do not appear to have seen the
lines of the living for quite some time.

211H 128V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NWU> u
Nearing The Top of the Mountain
The summit of the mountain can barely be made out even at this
distance. The wind blows much harder near the top of the mountain and the
biting cold makes it a very unpleasant place to be. There is no life
anywhere on the mountain and the only sound that can be heard is that of
the wind smashing against the peaks of the mountain. The path seems to lead
around the peak of the mountain but it's difficult to ascertain where
exactly one is in relation to the lower regions of the mountain.

A Path Around A Mountain
The path continues around the backside of the mountain but the east
side of the mountain is not distinguishable from the west side of the
mountain. The upper regions of the mountain are blocked by a thick fog
which seems to hang over the peak. Fierce winds howl throughout the
mountain giving it a greater sense of foreboding. There is no life anywhere
on the mountain just a few beaten paths that do not appear to have seen the
lines of the living for quite some time.

A Path Around A Mountain
The bleak looking mountain shoots up into the air, seeming to pierce
the sky. It is difficult to see the top of the mountain due to the haze
that seems to be hanging around the mountain. Fierce winds blow causing
strange noises to be heard everywhere. No life can be seen anywhere, this
place is dead to the world and seems to not to have seen the living in
eons. There is a feeling of danger that hangs over the mountain, obviously
one should tread lightly.

398H 140V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:NSU> u
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

You see nothing special.
Looking down:
You see nothing special.

398H 134V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:EWU> e
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

398H 126V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:EWU> u
Nearing The Top of the Mountain
The summit of the mountain can barely be made out even at this
distance. The wind blows much harder near the top of the mountain and the
biting cold makes it a very unpleasant place to be. There is no life
anywhere on the mountain and the only sound that can be heard is that of
the wind smashing against the peaks of the mountain. The path seems to lead
around the peak of the mountain but it's difficult to ascertain where
exactly one is in relation to the lower regions of the mountain.

398H 94V 1X 1C Mem:5 Exits:EWUD> u
Atop The Mountain's Summit
The summit of the mountain would provide a spectacular view of the
surrounding area, were it not for the dense fog which has surrounded it.
The wind blows harder here than anywhere else, its strength is enough to
chill any living creature to the bone. The only sign of life which exists
is a small tent which is miraculously set up atop this peak. A small tunnel
seems to run down the center of the mountain, and turning around, you
notice the path which lead you here has vanished.

398H 88V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NESW> n
As you start to climb down the path, you lose your footing and slide all
the way down the mountain. As you land in a daze, you regain your footing.
Woa kneels down and studies the ground.
A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.

location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

388H 89V 1X 1C Mem:7 Exits:EWD> w
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.

The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.

West - A Path In The Mountains
Up - Nearing The Top of the Mountain

388H 83V 1X 1C Mem:7 Exits:EWU> u
Nearing The Top of the Mountain
The summit of the mountain can barely be made out even at this
distance. The wind blows much harder near the top of the mountain and the
biting cold makes it a very unpleasant place to be. There is no life
anywhere on the mountain and the only sound that can be heard is that of
the wind smashing against the peaks of the mountain. The path seems to lead
around the peak of the mountain but it's difficult to ascertain where
exactly one is in relation to the lower regions of the mountain.

388H 55V 1X 1C Mem:7 Exits:EWUD> u
Atop The Mountain's Summit
The summit of the mountain would provide a spectacular view of the
surrounding area, were it not for the dense fog which has surrounded it.
The wind blows harder here than anywhere else, its strength is enough to
chill any living creature to the bone. The only sign of life which exists
is a small tent which is miraculously set up atop this peak. A small tunnel
seems to run down the center of the mountain, and turning around, you
notice the path which lead you here has vanished.

388H 49V 1X 1C Mem:4 Exits:NESW> As you start to climb down the path, you lose your footing and slide all
the way down the mountain. As you land in a daze, you regain your footing.
A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.

A Path Around A Mountain
The bleak looking mountain shoots up into the air, seeming to pierce
the sky. It is difficult to see the top of the mountain due to the haze
that seems to be hanging around the mountain. Fierce winds blow causing
strange noises to be heard everywhere. No life can be seen anywhere, this
place is dead to the world and seems to not to have seen the living in
eons. There is a feeling of danger that hangs over the mountain, obviously
one should tread lightly.
A yellowish, green haze fills the air of the room.

Before a Majestic Mountain
An enormous mountain rising high into the sky just north of here,
blotting out the horizon. The path leading to the foot of the mountain is
littered with large boulders and smaller rock cast off from the mountain
itself. To the south, the eastern gate of Old Tarsis welcomes you into the
city.

398H 64V 1X 1C Mem:4 Exits:NS> s
Before The Ruined Gate
The city of Old Tarsis spreads out west of here, through the large
gates leading into the city. Further south, an arid desert wasteland
stretches off to the horizon, dotted with cacti, and dried shrubbery. The
northern horizon is dominated by a towering mountain, rising majestically
into the sky.

Before A Parched Wasteland
The dry expanse of the desert covers the horizon, spotted with
occasional patches of dried shrubbery and cacti. The rolling dunes seem to
stretch out into forever, and it isn't likely that you would find any
refreshment in this sandy wasteland. The eastern gates of Old Tarsis just
north of here, seem much more inviting.

398H 60V 1X 1C Mem:4 Exits:NS> Before The Ruined Gate
The city of Old Tarsis spreads out west of here, through the large
gates leading into the city. Further south, an arid desert wasteland
stretches off to the horizon, dotted with cacti, and dried shrubbery. The
northern horizon is dominated by a towering mountain, rising majestically

398H 58V 1X 1C Mem:4 Exits:NSW> w
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

398H 57V 1X 1C Mem:4 Exits:NEW> w
Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

398H 101V 1X 1C Exits:NEW> w
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

398H 100V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:NESW> e
Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered

398H 98V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:NESW> n
Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

398H 97V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NES> e
Before the Courthouse
The building to the south once served as the city hall and courthouse
for Tarsis. Even now, in its dilapidated state, the building still has an
air of importance and authority. One of the main city roads lies to the
west, while the road leads eastward, towards the cities former markets.

398H 96V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:ESW> e
The Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.

398H 95V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NSW> n
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.

Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

398H 90V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NESW> TICK IN 16 SECONDS.
w
Before the Bank
The broken road leading to the cities bank crunches and cracks beneath
your feet. Having survived the chaos and destruction that took this city to
ruin, then withstanding the gradual decay of time has left this road in a
dismal state of ruin. Small chips of stone and gravel crunch beneath your
feet and the floor is cracked and broken in several places, leaving the
floor very uneven and difficult to traverse.

398H 89V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NEW> n
The Bank
Shattered wooden stalls are all that remains of this bank. The
furniture that once filled this bank is broken and shattered, and the vault
that once occupied the rear of the bank has been crushed by portions of the
building that have collapsed onto it.

398H 87V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NEW> w
Northern Road
The stone tiles of this road have long since lost their form and
structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some parts.
Broken stone and gravel speckle the road, causing each footfall to create
an eery "crunching" sound. The main road runs north, towards the city
gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.

398H 86V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NES> n
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

398H 85V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NESW> n
Before The Ruined Gate
The city of Old Tarsis dominates the southern horizon, the rooftops
cutting into the sky. Trees and bushes growing to the west and eventually
increase in frequency before turning into a magnificent forest. While to
the east, small rocks and boulders cast off from the mountain in the
distance litter the road, making travel difficult.

398H 84V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:ESW> sca
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
Before a Majestic Mountain
Towering high into the sky just east of here is a massive mountain,
blotting out the sky. The hard stone surface of the mountain has been worn
from decades of bearing the elements. Rocks and boulders of varying sizes
litter the road here, before the mountain. Farther west from the mountain,
as the rocks and boulders thin, the northern gates of Old Tarsis stand
welcoming.

398H 77V 1X 1C Mem:6 Exits:NESW> e
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

398H 117V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:NESW> s
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

398H 116V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NSW> s
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

398H 115V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NESW> s
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

398H 114V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NS> s
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
Before The Ruined Gate
The city gates of Old Tarsis stand to the north, while the rooftops of
the city itself cover the horizon. The burning sands of the desert to the
east appear much less inviting than the city to the north. Likewise, the
murky swamps west of here are dark and thick with vegetation growing up out
of the waters.

398H 113V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NEW> w

Before A Marshy Wetlands
The murky water and thick vegetation of the swamps lie just west of
here. Thick vines wrap themselves around the trees, creating a thick canopy
that occasionally droops down into the dark waters. On the dry land to the
east the southern gates of Old Tarsis stand invitingly.

398H 111V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:EW> w
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
A Path Out Of The Swamp
In the middle of this wet wasteland, you have managed to find a small
hill which manages to provide some relief from the hellish marshes which
surround you. Unfortunately, you are still stuck deep inside the swamp, and
will have to leave to find your way out.

398H 109V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NEW> e
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
Before A Marshy Wetlands
The murky water and thick vegetation of the swamps lie just west of
here. Thick vines wrap themselves around the trees, creating a thick canopy
that occasionally droops down into the dark waters. On the dry land to the
east the southern gates of Old Tarsis stand invitingly.

398H 107V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:EW> e
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
Before The Ruined Gate
The city gates of Old Tarsis stand to the north, while the rooftops of
the city itself cover the horizon. The burning sands of the desert to the
east appear much less inviting than the city to the north. Likewise, the
murky swamps west of here are dark and thick with vegetation growing up out
of the waters.
a bottle of Aquafina mineral water lies here [4]

398H 105V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NEW> n
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

398H 104V 1X 1C Mem:3 Exits:NS> n
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

A Broken Road
Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.

Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis

of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

423H 150V 1X 1C Exits:D> d
A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from

mountain.

356H 148V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:NSUD> s
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Inky darkness flows into the area. [2]
The barbaric celestial, Acadia, measures you up from afar.
Fisomu the Male Hylar Dwarf is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Viran, Mighty Lion With The Horrible Roar is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Samasaki Stonefoot is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Habutz the Male Human is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

356H 142V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:ESD> s
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Inky darkness flows into the area. [2]
Eki the Male Human is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

356H 140V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:NSUD> d
A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.

275H 138V 1X 1C [Me:Fair] [Gill:Fair] [Ildarius:Bad] Mem:2 Exits:NSU> You flee head over heels.
A Path In The Mountains
The path leads higher up in to the mountains away from civilization.
The summit is still completely obscured by fog but the wind seems to be
growing in proximity and strength as one ascends the mountain. Life is none
existent on the mountain, as much due to the harsh climate as the remote
location of the mountain. Despite the wind there is an eerie stillness that
seems to hint at lurking danger.
Inky darkness flows into the area. [2]
Acadia is standing here, fighting Mabel.

. . . has a tough exterior.

. . . has a tough exterior.

. . . has a tough exterior.

. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

275H 132V 1X 1C Mem:2 Exits:EWU> u
Nearing The Top of the Mountain
The summit of the mountain can barely be made out even at this
distance. The wind blows much harder near the top of the mountain and the
biting cold makes it a very unpleasant place to be. There is no life
anywhere on the mountain and the only sound that can be heard is that of
the wind smashing against the peaks of the mountain. The path seems to lead
around the peak of the mountain but it's difficult to ascertain where
exactly one is in relation to the lower regions of the mountain.
Inky darkness flows into the area. [2]
Naru Narusegawa, Infernal Fan Service is standing here.
Edwai, Wildly Searching for his Badger is standing here.
A man stands here, ready to prepare you for the tournament.

A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.
Inky darkness flows into the area.

423H 150V 1X 2C Exits:D> d
A Path Around A Mountain
The path seems to run around the base of the ancient mountain. No life
can be seen anywhere, it is as if all that was living simply vanished. The
path seems well kept but there is little to no wear. Fierce winds gust from
every direction, making the mountain even more formidable. A dense fog
hangs over the top of the mountain preventing a better view of the
mountain.
Kooz FireForge, Blood Brother is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Woa Nitro, Honorary Blood Sea Dane is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Tariel the Male Hill Dwarf is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.
A man stands here, ready to prepare you for the tournament.

A Path Around A Mountain
The bleak looking mountain shoots up into the air, seeming to pierce
the sky. It is difficult to see the top of the mountain due to the haze
that seems to be hanging around the mountain. Fierce winds blow causing
strange noises to be heard everywhere. No life can be seen anywhere, this
place is dead to the world and seems to not to have seen the living in
eons. There is a feeling of danger that hangs over the mountain, obviously
one should tread lightly.

A Path Around A Mountain

423H 118V 1X 2C Exits:ESW> s
Before a Majestic Mountain
An enormous mountain rising high into the sky just north of here,
blotting out the horizon. The path leading to the foot of the mountain is
littered with large boulders and smaller rock cast off from the mountain
itself. To the south, the eastern gate of Old Tarsis welcomes you into the
city.

423H 116V 1X 2C Exits:NS> s
Before The Ruined Gate
The city of Old Tarsis spreads out west of here, through the large
gates leading into the city. Further south, an arid desert wasteland
stretches off to the horizon, dotted with cacti, and dried shrubbery. The
northern horizon is dominated by a towering mountain, rising majestically
into the sky.

423H 114V 1X 2C Exits:NSW>
The sky is now cloudless.

423H 114V 1X 2C Exits:NSW> w
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

423H 113V 1X 2C Exits:NEW> w
Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

423H 112V 1X 2C Exits:NEW> w
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

Western Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis
wastelands.

423H 110V 1X 2C Exits:ESW> A Broken Road
Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.

423H 109V 1X 2C Exits:NEW> w
Before the Forge
Once, many warriors frequented this section of town. Between the
weapons shop to the south, the inn just a short distance to the west and
the bar to the north, everything a young warrior needed could be found
here. Now, the only thing left of the building to the north is a pile of
rubble and the shop to the south has long since been deserted.

423H 145V 1X 2C Exits:ESW> s
A Broken Forge
This large room has long since been emptied. Whatever was not destroyed
when this city was ravaged had been looted in the aftermath. The eastern
wall has collapsed, leaving only an immovable pile of rubble. The warriors
training ground that once resided to the east is no more.

423H 144V 1X 2C Exits:N> li
Sorry, but you cannot do that here!

423H 144V 1X 2C Exits:N> n
Before the Forge
Once, many warriors frequented this section of town. Between the
weapons shop to the south, the inn just a short distance to the west and
the bar to the north, everything a young warrior needed could be found
here. Now, the only thing left of the building to the north is a pile of
rubble and the shop to the south has long since been deserted.

423H 143V 1X 2C Exits:ESW> e
A Broken Road
Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.
Ausirien Blackmane, Wild and Crazy Kid is standing here. (flying)
. . . is surrounded by a white mist.
Ostap Bender, Great Combinator is standing here. (flying)
Galadhine de-Orilg, Hekturion Squire of Solamnia is standing here. (flying)
Dash a'Peppa, Spicing up the Solamnic Army is standing here. (flying)

423H 142V 1X 2C Exits:NEW> e
Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

423H 141V 1X 2C Exits:NSW> s
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

423H 140V 1X 2C Exits:NESW> s
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

423H 135V 1X 2C Exits:NS> s
Before The Ruined Gate
The city gates of Old Tarsis stand to the north, while the rooftops of
the city itself cover the horizon. The burning sands of the desert to the
east appear much less inviting than the city to the north. Likewise, the
murky swamps west of here are dark and thick with vegetation growing up out
of the waters.

423H 134V 1X 2C Exits:NEW> e
Before A Parched Wasteland
The rolling dunes of the arid desert to the east continue off to the
horizon. A few small patches of dried shrubbery and small collections of
cacti appear to be the only living things out in that sandy wasteland. The
gates to the city of Old Tarsis stand just to the west of here, a much more
inviting destination than the desert.

262H 150V 1X 2C Mem:12 Exits:EW> Before A Parched Wasteland
The rolling dunes of the arid desert to the east continue off to the
horizon. A few small patches of dried shrubbery and small collections of
cacti appear to be the only living things out in that sandy wasteland. The
gates to the city of Old Tarsis stand just to the west of here, a much more
inviting destination than the desert.

A Pathway Out Of The Desert
There is a noticeable path atop this large sand dune, apparently
leading out of the desert to a more hospitable climate. To the west you can
barely make out the derelict spires of a large city.

262H 148V 1X 2C Mem:12 Exits:EW> e
The Barren Wastes
The desert is incredibly barren and gives off the scent of death at
every turn. Sand is everywhere and makes the desert seem endless. It is
impossible to get a bearing on where the desert starts and stops due to the
endless dunes in all directions. The unbearable heat is exacerbated by the
stale air and the lack of a breeze.

To the east there appears to an oasis, which seems odd given the bleak
nature of the desert. Signs of life can be seen in this area, which is in
stark contrast to the rest of the desert. The heat is not as intolerable as

262H 130V 1X 2C Mem:12 Exits:ESW> e
The Oasis
In the middle of this barren wasteland, you have stumbled across a
green and fertile patch of land. Animals of all sorts gather around the
oasis to drink and make merry. The desert is alive with the sound of music,
which emanates from a small cluster of tents set up along the north side of
the lake. Bubbles occasionally burst from the water, as if escaping from
some underground area.

A Huge Desert
The desert seems huge an unending, there is life no where to be found.
The air is still and stagnant while the heat is almost unbearable. One
expects a barren waste in a desert but this desert has nothing but sand in
all directions.

even the slightest hint of a breeze making the air terrible to breath.

The Barren Wastes
The desert is incredibly barren and gives off the scent of death at
every turn. Sand is everywhere and makes the desert seem endless. It is
impossible to get a bearing on where the desert starts and stops due to the
endless dunes in all directions. The unbearable heat is exacerbated by the
stale air and the lack of a breeze.
A yellowish, green haze fills the air of the room.

The Barren Wastes
The desert is incredibly barren and gives off the scent of death at
every turn. Sand is everywhere and makes the desert seem endless. It is
impossible to get a bearing on where the desert starts and stops due to the
endless dunes in all directions. The unbearable heat is exacerbated by the
stale air and the lack of a breeze.

394H 137V 1X 2C Mem:10 Exits:NESW> n
The Oasis
In the middle of this barren wasteland, you have stumbled across a
green and fertile patch of land. Animals of all sorts gather around the
oasis to drink and make merry. The desert is alive with the sound of music,
which emanates from a small cluster of tents set up along the north side of
the lake. Bubbles occasionally burst from the water, as if escaping from
some underground area.

expects a barren waste in a desert but this desert has nothing but sand in
all directions.

stale air and the lack of a breeze.

394H 81V 1X 2C Mem:10 Exits:ESW> w
The Oasis
In the middle of this barren wasteland, you have stumbled across a
green and fertile patch of land. Animals of all sorts gather around the
oasis to drink and make merry. The desert is alive with the sound of music,
which emanates from a small cluster of tents set up along the north side of
the lake. Bubbles occasionally burst from the water, as if escaping from
some underground area.
Sir Woobis of Anfield, Lord Clerist of the Knights of Solamnia is SITTING here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
A bronze dragon with glistening scales awaits a rider.

. . . has a tough exterior.

. . . has a tough exterior.

398H 114V 1X 2C Mem:9 Exits:ESW> s
Endless Fields of Sand
Nothing but sand can be seen in every direction. This desert is truly
bleak and miserable. The agonizing heat in culmination with the stale and
stagnant air makes it almost impossible to survive let alone function.
There is no life to be seen anywhere.

To the west there appears to an oasis, which seems odd given the bleak
nature of the desert. Signs of life can be seen in this area, which is in
stark contrast to the rest of the desert. The heat is not as intolerable as
in other parts of the desert although it is hardly comfortable.

398H 141V 1X 8C Mem:2 Exits:NESW> e
A Huge Desert
The desert seems huge an unending, there is life no where to be found.
The air is still and stagnant while the heat is almost unbearable. One
expects a barren waste in a desert but this desert has nothing but sand in
all directions.
Samasaki Stonefoot is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Habutz the Male Human is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

398H 127V 1X 8C Mem:2 Exits:NEW> e
The Barren Wastes
The desert is incredibly barren and gives off the scent of death at
every turn. Sand is everywhere and makes the desert seem endless. It is
impossible to get a bearing on where the desert starts and stops due to the
endless dunes in all directions. The unbearable heat is exacerbated by the
stale air and the lack of a breeze.
A man stands here, ready to prepare you for the tournament.

398H 125V 1X 8C Mem:2 Exits:NESW> e
By the Oasis
To the north there appears to an oasis, which seems odd given the bleak
nature of the desert. Signs of life can be seen in this area, which is in
stark contrast to the rest of the desert. The heat is not as intolerable as
in other parts of the desert although it is hardly comfortable.

The Barren Wastes
The desert is incredibly barren and gives off the scent of death at
every turn. Sand is everywhere and makes the desert seem endless. It is
impossible to get a bearing on where the desert starts and stops due to the
endless dunes in all directions. The unbearable heat is exacerbated by the
stale air and the lack of a breeze.

398H 90V 1X 8C Exits:EW> w
Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
Before A Parched Wasteland
The rolling dunes of the arid desert to the east continue off to the
horizon. A few small patches of dried shrubbery and small collections of
cacti appear to be the only living things out in that sandy wasteland. The
gates to the city of Old Tarsis stand just to the west of here, a much more
inviting destination than the desert.
You feel a strong wind blowing here.

bearings. No sunlight Penetrates the thick canopy of trees which creates a
ceiling above your head. No air circulates through this dismal area, and
every step causes you to sink a little bit more into the water which
stagnates around you.

In the middle of this wet wasteland, you have managed to find a small
hill which manages to provide some relief from the hellish marshes which
surround you. Unfortunately, you are still stuck deep inside the swamp, and
will have to leave to find your way out.

here. Thick vines wrap themselves around the trees, creating a thick canopy
that occasionally droops down into the dark waters. On the dry land to the
east the southern gates of Old Tarsis stand invitingly.

Before The Ruined Gate
The city gates of Old Tarsis stand to the north, while the rooftops of
the city itself cover the horizon. The burning sands of the desert to the
east appear much less inviting than the city to the north. Likewise, the
murky swamps west of here are dark and thick with vegetation growing up out
of the waters.

351H 148V 1X 8C [**Kooz:Perfect**] Mem:11 Exits:NEW> n
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

351H 140V 1X 8C [**Kooz:Perfect**] Mem:11 Exits:NEW> w
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

Dry dust stirs into small clouds with every step you take. The road
here appears to be unfinished, the stone tiles give way to dirt and sand as
it approaches the wastelands. There air here is dry, and there is an
unnerving stillness here.

351H 134V 1X 8C [**Kooz:Perfect**] Mem:11 Exits:NEW> e
A Small Road
Fallen buildings, ruined archways and shattered stone are all that
remain of the road here. The road extends west, towards the Tarsis
Wastelands, and east towards the cities gate.

351H 133V 1X 8C [**Kooz:Perfect**] Mem:11 Exits:EW> e
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

351H 132V 1X 8C [**Kooz:Perfect**] Mem:11 Exits:NESW> s
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

351H 131V 1X 8C [**Kooz:Perfect**] Mem:11 Exits:NS> s
Before The Ruined Gate
The city gates of Old Tarsis stand to the north, while the rooftops of
the city itself cover the horizon. The burning sands of the desert to the
east appear much less inviting than the city to the north. Likewise, the
murky swamps west of here are dark and thick with vegetation growing up out
of the waters.

Before A Marshy Wetlands

that occasionally droops down into the dark waters. On the dry land to the
east the southern gates of Old Tarsis stand invitingly.

398H 144V 1X 8C Mem:11 Exits:NESW> e
Lost Inside A Brackish Swamp
Having stumbled into this foul swamp, you find yourself without ant
bearings. No sunlight Penetrates the thick canopy of trees which creates a
ceiling above your head. No air circulates through this dismal area, and
every step causes you to sink a little bit more into the water which
stagnates around you.

will have to leave to find your way out.

398H 150V 1X 8C Mem:11 Exits:NEW> Kooz kneels down and studies the ground.
Before A Parched Wasteland
The rolling dunes of the arid desert to the east continue off to the
horizon. A few small patches of dried shrubbery and small collections of
cacti appear to be the only living things out in that sandy wasteland. The
gates to the city of Old Tarsis stand just to the west of here, a much more
inviting destination than the desert.

398H 142V 1X 8C Mem:11 Exits:NEW> n
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

398H 141V 1X 8C Mem:11 Exits:NS> n
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

398H 140V 1X 8C Mem:11 Exits:NESW> n
Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

398H 139V 1X 8C Mem:11 Exits:NSW> w
A Broken Road
Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.

398H 138V 1X 8C Mem:11 Exits:NEW> w
Before the Forge
Once, many warriors frequented this section of town. Between the
weapons shop to the south, the inn just a short distance to the west and
the bar to the north, everything a young warrior needed could be found
here. Now, the only thing left of the building to the north is a pile of
rubble and the shop to the south has long since been deserted.

398H 150V 1X 8C Exits:ESW> w
Outside the Tarsis Inn
The Tarsis Inn, to the west, is one of the few buildings that remains
mostly intact. The sign that once hung above the inns door has nearly
fallen from its perch: it hangs by a single hook now, ready to fall and
shatter itself onto the cobblestone road.

398H 149V 1X 8C Exits:NESW> n
Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

Outside the Tarsis Inn
The Tarsis Inn, to the west, is one of the few buildings that remains
mostly intact. The sign that once hung above the inns door has nearly
fallen from its perch: it hangs by a single hook now, ready to fall and
shatter itself onto the cobblestone road.

Before the Forge
Once, many warriors frequented this section of town. Between the
weapons shop to the south, the inn just a short distance to the west and
the bar to the north, everything a young warrior needed could be found
here. Now, the only thing left of the building to the north is a pile of
rubble and the shop to the south has long since been deserted.

A Broken Road
Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.

398H 139V 1X 8C Exits:NEW> e
Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

398H 138V 1X 8C Exits:NSW> n
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

398H 135V 1X 8C Exits:NESW> n
Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

398H 134V 1X 8C Exits:NES> n
Northern Road
The stone tiles of this road have long since lost their form and
structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some parts.
Broken stone and gravel speckle the road, causing each footfall to create
an eery "crunching" sound. The main road runs north, towards the city
gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.

398H 133V 1X 8C Exits:NES> n
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

398H 132V 1X 8C Exits:NESW> w
A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to gain
access to the tower.

398H 131V 1X 8C Exits:EW> w
The Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while the
path itself has been broken by weeds.

398H 130V 1X 8C Exits:ESW> w
Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.

398H 129V 1X 8C Exits:ESW> s
Lost Knowledge
Once, great scholars came to this library to scour over tomes
containing knowledge of the arcane arts, history, science, mathematics and
countless other subjects. Now all of that is lost. Whatever was not
crushed, burned or otherwise destroyed has long since turned to dust. The
countless shelves that were once lined with books are nowhere to be seen
amidst the rubble.

A Path Through the Park
This dry, dusty pathy leads north-south through the old Tarsis park.
This park was once full of life, a lush, vibrant forest rich with color and

up into small clouds with every footstep. The once-lush Tarsis Park lies in
ruin to the north, and the entrance to the cities temple is to the west.

398H 112V 1X 8C Exits:NSW> w
Within the Broken Temple
This large, now-empty chamber once served as the entryway into the
Tarsis temple. The floor, once a polished, shiny marble, is dull and
cracked, having lost it's sheen long ago. There is a chamber to the north
that served as the clerics guild, and the exit to the temple lies to the
east.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

faded, it still shows a myriad of color. This wagon once belonged to a
gypsy fortune teller, although there are no signs of any life around here
anymore.

289H 98V 1X 8C Exits:EW> e
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

289H 97V 1X 8C Exits:NESW> n
Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.
a bottle of Aquafina mineral water lies here [2]
Lord Feroz, Bashing His Way Into Your Soul is standing here. (flying)
Ahrimen the Male Wild Elf is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

289H 96V 1X 8C Exits:NSW> n
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
a bottle of Aquafina mineral water lies here [3]
Woa Nitro, Honorary Blood Sea Dane is standing here.

289H 95V 1X 8C Exits:NESW> n
Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

Lost Inside A Brackish Swamp
Having stumbled into this foul swamp, you find yourself without ant
bearings. No sunlight Penetrates the thick canopy of trees which creates a
ceiling above your head. No air circulates through this dismal area, and
every step causes you to sink a little bit more into the water which
stagnates around you.

423H 135V 1X 1C Exits:NESW> s
A Path Out Of The Swamp
As you manage to stumble out of the swamp, the foul smell which has
plagued you starts to fade. Your feet squelch as you leave the muck and
begin to cross a small field, which has sprung up on the edge of the swamp.
Small black flowers speckle the ground, and their aroma begins to have a
soporific effect upon you.
A man stands here, ready to prepare you for the tournament.

423H 134V 1X 1C Exits:NES> s
A Breath of Fresh Air
Finally! A breath of fresh air. You breathe in the salty air, and no
longer detect any trace of decay in your nostrils. Behind you, the swamp
menaces, it's tall trees beckoning you as they sway in the wind. However,
as you peer ahead, you notice that the grass underfoot begins to turn
slowly into sand, and you think you can make out a beach ahead of you.

423H 132V 1X 1C Exits:NS> s
A Sandy Beach
You stand upon the shores of a beautiful beach. The waves slowly nip at
your heels, and you quickly move higher up on the shore. Around you birds
fly, and fish leap out of the water, towards the sky.

423H 130V 1X 1C Exits:NES> s
Overlooking The Ocean
Having navigated the steep sand dune, you find yourself atop it amidst
the scrub brush. The ocean stretches on for miles and miles in front of
you, and the wind whispers sweet nothings as it stirs across the dunes and
kicks up sand. You notice that there is a small tent set up atop the dunes,
as well as what appears to be a thin layer of grass, which covers a hole
leading down into the heart of the dune itself.
